member.name: T:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestContactListGet
member.summary: This request is intended for building a ScrollableList object based on provided constraints. Depending on the Restricted parameter, lookup filter is applied in Contact table or in ContactAttribute table. Depending on database indexes, the type of Operator used, the size of the tables, and many other parameters, it can be more interesting (in terms of performance) to set Restricted to TRUE or to FALSE. There is no general rule and this really depends on the filter used, and on the database used. Because the Contact table contains only a subset of Contact Attribute values (they are called sortable Contact Attributes), it is not possible to use any Contact Attribute in a filter when Restricted is set to TRUE. Note also that the data returned by the lookup request comes from the Contact table only. In the same way, the ordering of the Contacts returned is done using Contact data only.

item.description: The unique tenant ID.

This event indicates that the RequestContactListGet was successful, and contains a list of contacts matching the criteria specified in that request. Note that data returned in EventContactListGet comes from the Contact table only. In the same way, the ordering of the Contacts returned is done using Contact data only.
Indicates that the request encountered an error.

member.summary: Asks UCS to return total count of matching Contacts. Setting this parameter to TRUE results in an extra database query which will decrease performance. Default value: False.

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestContactListGet.Restricted
member.summary: If TRUE, filtering uses primary sortable attributes (Contact table), if FALSE, filtering uses all attributes (ContactAttribute table). Default value: False.

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestContactListGet.PageMaxSize
member.summary: If no value is provided, UCS configured value (settings/max-select-count) is used.

member.summary: List of sortable attributes to return. If AttributeList KVList is null or is not passed, all attributes are returned.

member.summary: No filtering if not present.

member.summary: No ordering if not present.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.SimpleSearchCriteria.AttrName
member.summary:
The system name of a Contact Attribute as declared in Configuration Server (Tenant specific configuration).
Note: If the Restricted parameter was set to TRUE, then the value must be the system name of a sortable Contact Attribute.

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.SimpleSearchCriteria.AttrValue
member.summary:
The value type of this parameter depends on the Contact Attribute type declared in Config Server (settings/type). If type is set to:
string (default) - value must be a String
date - value must be a String formatted with the pattern: "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ"

member.name: T:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.SortCriteria
member.summary:
String that represents either a Contact object attribute name ("Id", "TenantId", "IsExternalResource", "CreatedDate", "ModifiedDate", "MergeId") or a sortable Contact Attribute system name.
Note: To make a Contact Attribute sortable, you must configure that Contact Attribute as sortable (settings/is-sortable) in ConfigServer. EmailAddress, PhoneNumber, FirstName and LastName are sortable by default.

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.SortCriteria.SortOperator
member.summary: Can have value of 'Ascending' or 'Descending'.

Depending on database indexes, the type of Operator used, the size of the tables, and many other parameters, it can be more interesting (in terms of performance) to set Restricted to TRUE or to FALSE. There is no general rule and this really depends on the filter used, and on the database used. Because the Contact table contains only a subset of Contact Attribute values (they are called sortable Contact Attributes), it is not possible to use any Contact Attribute in a filter when Restricted is set to TRUE. Note also that the data returned by the lookup request comes from the Contact table only. In the same way, the ordering of the Contacts returned is done using Contact data only.

member.name: T:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestGetInteractionsForContact
member.summary: This request is intended for delivering all or some of the interactions (depending on filtering) for the contact in question. The aim of this request is to provide the Interaction history. It returns only attributes from the Interaction table. It cannot be otherwise because we cannot get MediaServer specific attributes (which are scattered in multiple tables) in one request. Specific MediaServers attributes may be retrieved individually by calling RequestGetInteractionContent.

item.description: Unique ID of the contact whose interactions are requested.

This event returns all (or some, depending on filtering) of the interactions for a specified Contact. The purpose of this event is to provide the Interaction history. Only attributes from the Interaction table are returned. Specific MediaServers attributes may be retrieved individually by calling RequestGetInteractionContent.
Indicates that the request encountered an error.

member.name: T:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestAddDocument
member.summary:
This request is intended to add a document to an Interaction. This request can be used in 2 modes:
Link creation mode: UCS only creates an Attachment record to associate an existing Interaction (defined by the InteractionId parameter) to an existing Document (defined by the DocumentId parameter).
Document creation mode: UCS creates an Attachment record and a Document record and associates them to an existing Interaction (defined by the InteractionId parameter). The Document record is created using the parameters MimeType, TheName, Description, TheSize, Content. UCS returns the DocumentId in response.
UCS automatically works in "Link creation mode" when a parameter "DocumentId" is present in the request.

item.description: The unique ID of the Interaction.
The unique ID of the Document. Maximum length is 16 characters. Only mandatory for "link creation mode".
String value specifying the MIME type for this attachement. Maximum length is 256 characters. Only mandatory for "document creation mode".
The name of the attachment. Maximum length is 256 characters. Only mandatory for "document creation mode".
The size of the attachment. Only mandatory for "document creation mode".
This event indicates that a document was successfully added to an Interaction.
Indicates that the request encountered an error.

member.name: T:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Events.EventAddDocument
member.summary: This event indicates that a document was successfully added to an Interaction.

item.description: A unique ID of the added document. Only mandatory in "document creation mode".

This request is intended to add a document to an Interaction. This request can be used in 2 modes:
Link creation mode: UCS only creates an Attachment record to associate an existing Interaction (defined by the InteractionId parameter) to an existing Document (defined by the DocumentId parameter).
Document creation mode: UCS creates an Attachment record and a Document record and associates them to an existing Interaction (defined by the InteractionId parameter). The Document record is created using the parameters MimeType, TheName, Description, TheSize, Content. UCS returns the DocumentId in response.
UCS automatically works in "Link creation mode" when a parameter "DocumentId" is present in the request.

member.name: T:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestSearch
member.summary:
This request provides the ability to search for UCS documents - standard responses, contacts, or interactions - that match the string-based queries you create.
Search results rely on the UCS indexing service, which can be configured to parse and inxes the content of UCS entries. UCS indexing should be scheduled for off-hours, and should be event-based indexing so that modified properties will be re-indexed.
You can use RequestGetIndexProperties to create a list of key field names that are searchable.
Note that this type of search is not done in UCS database, so the results cannot be used to update UCS documents. Once a desired UCS document is identified using this request, then a query must be sent to the DB to process any desired updates.

item.description: Identifies the object that needs to be queried in UCS indexing service.
Defines the query to be processed.
This event returns a list of UCS documents - standard responses, contacts, or interactions - that match the string-based queries submitted in RequestSearch.
Indicates that the request encountered an error.

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestSearch.IndexName
member.summary: String value that identifies the index that you want to query in the UCS indexing service. Index values are customizable, so use RequestGetIndexProperties to check field names that are searchable.

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestSearch.MaxResults
member.summary: Maximum number of returned documents.

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestSearch.Query
member.summary: Defines the query to be processed. For details about creating queries, please refer to the following Apache Lucene Query Parser Syntax documentation (http://lucene.apache.org/java/2_4_0/queryparsersyntax.html).

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestSearch.DefaultFields
member.summary:
String value that specifies one or more default fields to search. If this parameter is set, then any string specified in the Query parameter will automatically be searched for in every field specified here.
For example, using a Query of "EmailAddress:john OR FirstName:john" (with DefaultFields left empty) is the same as using a Query of "john" with DefaultFields set to "EmailAddress,FirstName".

member.name: T:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestBoostDocument
member.summary: This request increases document priority towards requests. This can be used with SRL for example, in order to enable one SRL to have higher weight against others and thus returning first.

item.description: The index name where this boost is applied.
The unique document ID.
Floating point number that is passed as a string, indicating the factor to boost this document priority by.

Indicates whether RequestBoostDocument was successful or not. A list of possible error codes is included below:
Error Code 950: Indexing is disabled (change configuration options).
Error Code 951: Index searching is disabled (change configuration options).
Error Code 952: Incorrect IndexName specified: '{0}'.
Error Code 954: Unable to search in index: '{0}'.
Error Code 955: Unable to find document '{0}' in index: '{1}'.
Indicates that the request encountered an error.

member.summary: String value containing a unique index for this request.

member.summary: String value containing the document name.

member.name: P:Genesyslab.Platform.Contacts.Protocols.ContactServer.Requests.RequestBoostDocument.BoostFactor
member.summary: A float number that is passed as a sting, indicating the priority. Higher values recieve higher priority. The default value (if not returned during a Search request) is "1.0".
